definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Both companies sell kitchen equipment. They should compete equally.
sentences.chinese: 两个公司都销售厨房设备，他们应该公平竞争。

sentences.english: AIMD flow and TCP flow can fairly compete network resources with each other.
sentences.chinese: 可以与TCP之间实现网络资源的公平竞争。

sentences.english: We'll see. What we hope for is a situation more like in the west, where there is fair competition.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望国内形势能像西方国家一样，大家公平竞争。

sentences.english: Unfair competition had knocked up the once flourishing business.
sentences.chinese: 不公平竞争使得一度繁荣的商业遭到了破坏。

sentences.english: His sense of decency and fair play made him refuse the offer.
sentences.chinese: 他的正直感和公平竞争意识使他拒绝了这一提议。

sentences.english: LeEr said no, but can be fair competition.
sentences.chinese: 乐儿说不行，但是可以公平竞争。

sentences.english: We will endeavour to promote fair competition.
sentences.chinese: 我们会致力促进公平竞争。

sentences.english: These kinds of actions undermine fair competition, which turns many off from competing at all.
sentences.chinese: 这类行为有损于公平竞争，挫伤了很多人的竞争意愿。

sentences.english: Information market has paid more attention to fair competition and survival of the fittest.
sentences.chinese: 信息市场政策注重于公平竞争和优胜劣汰。

sentences.english: But now Microsoft is accusing Google of being anti-competitive.
sentences.chinese: 但是现在微软控告谷歌不公平竞争。

sentences.english: Refrain from reciprocal agreements that refrain competition.
sentences.chinese: 避免会阻碍公平竞争的互惠协定。

sentences.english: Second, China will continue to build a market environment of fair competition.
sentences.chinese: 其次，中国将继续致力于营造公平竞争的市场环境。

sentences.english: A fair competition is encouraged for the development of the medium-and small-sized enterprises under the favorable circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 这为中小企业的发展创造了公平竞争的外部环境。

sentences.english: The officials also emphasized the importance of fair play during the bidding.
sentences.chinese: 奥申委官员同时强调申办奥运会中公平竞争的重要性。

sentences.english: Pro GREss on this issue will establish a sense of fair competition.
sentences.chinese: 在这一问题上的进展，将确立一种公平竞争的感觉。

definition: to treat everyone equally favorably (idiom); not to discriminate between people
to abuse one's position for personal gain (idiom)
